result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 02:10 PM Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in federal custody and arrangements have been unsuccessful. Atty. Zilles asks for case to be dismissed as Defendant is in custody until 2030 and case is rather old. State objects and will not dismiss case at this time. States recommendation is to let warrant out at this time and will schedule once Defendant is done with Federal Custody.
Status conference on March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Status conference on January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A James in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Catharine D. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives the preliminary hearing.  Court advises party of his right, accepts waiver and binds over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
